content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```python
import markdown
from markdown import Markdown

def extract_julia_code(md):
    md = markdown.Markdown()
    blocks = [block for block in md.split_blocks(md) if block.strip().startswith('```')]
    julia_code = '\n'.join([block[3:-3].strip() for block in blocks])
    return julia_code
```

This function works by first splitting the markdown document into separate code blocks using the `split_blocks` method. It then checks each block to see if it starts with a triple backticks (```), which is the standard way to start code blocks in markdown. 

If it does, it removes the fences from the beginning and end of the code block (using slice notation `[3:-3]`) and strips any leading or trailing white space before joining them together with newline characters.
